intro: Colignonia parviflora subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered colignonia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
